detaileddescription.para: DBusCounter is used to count usage of some resource such as memory.

simplesect.para: new counter or NULL on failure

briefdescription.para: Decrements refcount of the counter and possibly finalizes the counter.
Adjusts the value of the size counter by the given delta which may be positive or negative.

detaileddescription.para: This function may be called with locks held. After calling it, when any relevant locks are no longer held you must call _dbus_counter_notify().

parameterdescription.para: value to add to the size counter's current value

briefdescription.para: Calls the notify function from _dbus_counter_set_notify(), if that function has been specified and the counter has crossed the guard value (in either direction) since the last call to this function.

detaileddescription.para: This function must not be called with locks held, since it can call out to user code.

briefdescription.para: Adjusts the value of the unix fd counter by the given delta which may be positive or negative.

detaileddescription.para: This function may be called with locks held. After calling it, when any relevant locks are no longer held you must call _dbus_counter_notify().

parameterdescription.para: value to add to the unix fds counter's current value

briefdescription.para: Gets the current value of the size counter.
Gets the current value of the unix fd counter.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusCounter *counter, long size_guard_value, long unix_fd_guard_value, DBusCounterNotifyFunction function, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: _dbus_counter_set_notify

briefdescription.para: Sets the notify function for this counter; the notify function is called whenever the counter's values cross the guard values in either direction (moving up, or moving down).

parameterdescription.para: the value we're notified if the size counter crosses
the value we're notified if the unix fd counter crosses
function to call in order to notify
data to pass to the function
